jurisdiction.title: Immaculate Conception of Dardenne Catholic School

0AA2431E855E47A099ED22D3F4286E0F.description: Distinguish the powers and responsibilities of citizens and institutions to address and solve world problems post c.1450.

4B38D36CAAFB4575AE6D8EEFA286FA21.description: Analyze the causes and effects of the changing roles of class, ethnicity, race, gender, and age on world cultures post c. 1450.

C420C24CD84C4032A838FD91D0C45C0A.description: Analyze the technological, intellectual, artistic, and literary achievements of the modern era to determine how society reflects and challenges the status quo.

D55D95D38505428A8662D201724E564A.description: Analyze the process of globalization to determine its effects on global conflict and cooperation.

6E65BA663F274C85B33CA8F9AA882A59.description: Analyze causes and patterns of human rights violations and genocide and suggest resolutions for current and future conflicts.

70AABC2F7E8D4008B306D07DD75FA53D.description: Analyze political, social, cultural, artistic, and economic revolutions to determine how they impacted concepts of class, race, tribe, slavery, and caste affiliation

A6FB15C90CE549C986F75903A7485671.description: Analyze social and educational reform movements to determine their impact on the challenges brought about by revolutions

C1E15D32B4A84662B09519FC6A85D142.description: Analyze new technologies and new forms of energy to determine their effects on the lives of inviduals, groups, and societal organization.

E57FC34012E54B57A0A767CB69AD1AE2.description: Analyze the intellectual, artistic, and literary achievements of the Enlightenment and ensuing revolutions in order to determine how they challenged the status quo.

80976EC0BD6B4866854E0169C2DDB2DA.description: Trace the development and impact of religious reform on exploration, interactions, and conflicts among various groups and nations

EF0048EB103D439E8E8A5D0E23358950.description: Assess changing ideas of class, ethnicity, race, gender, and age to affect a person's roles in society and social institutions.

478BC679DCD34FE1A9719E0020567CB3.description: Determine the extent and impact of cultural exchange, interaction, and disruption that resulted from the Columbian Exchange and European expansion in the Eastern and Western Hemispheres.

A6277451AC6D458FAB98FAC6495D73A2.description: Analyze the exchange of people, goods, and ideas to determine their impact on global interdependence and conflict

186C39F7CF3940F0BE18EDD34CDD6FE8.description: Analyze the historic development of Islam as well as the expansion of Christianity, Islam, Hinduism, and Buddhism in order to explain their transformations and roles in conflict and cooperation

93DFE9655F0F424B9423D31668478DCE.description: Analyze the intellectual, architectural, and artistic achievements of the Renaissance resulting from the rebirth of Classical ideas.

44A625F60E834018A36E2884B7ECB6CE.description: Explain how scientific and technological advancements impacted the interconnectedness within and among regions.

E8880E6D36CD41E2B79FA5E209197A1A.description: Using a world history lens, examine the origins and impact of social structures and stratification on societies and relationships between peoples.

8E6686B047B6497C8F5F8EA19BB49E8B.description: Using a world history lens, describe how peoples’ perspectives shaped the sources/artifacts they created.

2649CA65F99F44F8A195F1E6E1B05BD6.description: Analyze the causes and effects of the changing roles of class, ethnicity, race, gender, and age on world cultures prior to c. 1450.

42726A623B6A49DEA7EF72E39041732D.description: Describe how the world view of individuals, social groups, and institutions change as a result of connections among regions.

0B4EE6684C8C4E9889F3971200809A06.description: From a historical perspective, explain the origin, structure, spread, and significant beliefs of Islam.

8A4F986CB0594ABFA928C613194DF705.description: Analyze scientific, technological, intellectual, and artistic advancements to determine the legacy of European, African, and Mesoamerican civilizations.

98AAD5D2FD3F4496B83F3AA1975F3B25.description: *From a historical perspective, explain the origin, structure, spread, and significant beliefs of Christianity (Should be taught through the lens of Catholicism)

3A4586403C3647B09B7BDB2E18D952FC.description: Analyze the extent and impact of cultural diffusion that results from empire building

F7D5A5AA9BAB40449E322E22BD840089.description: Analyze scientific, technological, intellectual, and artistic advancements to determine the legacy of the classical civilizations

EBC65DF8BA64465D92C2D457D92C360E.description: Explain the significance of art, mythology, literature, and philosophy to the culture and social order of classical civilizations.

2505BAC752A14AB193965F4B6CD8F0BF.description: Analyze scientific, technological, intellectual, and artistic advancements to determine the legacy of the ancient civilizations.

D6E2815E9CB24BD88D0BE5282BC575B7.description: Describe how the world view of social groups and institutions influence culture and define the position of the individual within various societies

2325EBB090444C48A52E880EC76F099F.description: Describe the origins, structure, and essential beliefs of Judaism, Hinduism, and Buddhism.

CA98339B6FF34B6B80E3CDA3B5437195.description: Explain the significance of monotheistic and polytheistic religions to the social and political order of early civilizations.

6199316A65D74400A938B5405EF01360.description: Using a world history lens, examine the origins and impact of social structures and stratification on societies and relationships between peoples

7D33A78753CF4483B5FECC7D262AE61B.description: Analyze the varying process of colonization and decolonization to compare their impact on and legacies in the world today

2DF0CDEB66164931BFE3F8F34AB271D1.description: Trace the origins and relationships among the world wars, revolutions, and global conflicts of the twentieth century to determine their impacts on the world today.

A1FBAB0C69354295967163B978FB9804.description: Analyze world-wide imperialism in the late nineteenth and twentieth centuries to determine its causes and consequences

0A9C4E579D1B4E3187AA53DB8317E356.description: Evaluate the impact on nationalism on existing and emerging nations post c.1450

08C1E5C920D24951B1D237523CF6AB94.description: Analyze political revolutions and reform movements in order to determine their enduring effects worldwide on the political expectations for selfgovernment and individual liberty.

53256EBFEEAC4B6183A4779784286E0E.description: Compare and contrast causes and significant outcomes of political revolutions during this era.

2CCE5E005C6A4F52A242D2861A44C41C.description: Evaluate the forms of republics over time to determine their implications for pre-revolutionary ideas and expectations during the Age of Revolution

E4A2C97CD6AB447AA00DAF7873845933.description: Explain the challenges and benefits of large land empires, including those found in Russia, China, and the Middle East.

89EECE61876E444F86248FEBA6DC2FE6.description: Analyze the causes and consequences of European overseas expansion to determine its effect on people and cultures in Europe, Asia, Africa, and the Americas

5D7E105E8348474A8D5094E4C16EED81.description: Analyze the historical context of the Protestant Reformation and Scientific Revolution to explain new institutions and ways of thinking, and explain their social, political, and economic impact.

AFC86E5C696C40BAA9DF1A1A6B8230A4.description: Explain how the Crusades, Black Death, and the resulting exchanges that followed impacted Europe and led to the Renaissance and Scientific Revolution

2672BD1D68984B63ABB887344E4C787F.description: Explain the causes and effects of the expansion of societies in Western Africa, the Byzantine Empire, Gupta India, Chinese Dynasties, and Muslim Empires.

942E913B25254C5289BAD1B89B765D46.description: Analyze the causes and consequences of a specific problem in world history post c.1450 as well as the challenges and opportunities faced by those trying to address the problem

3B5A2AA2F33342939E22EA7048D6E48A.description: Using an inquiry lens, develop compelling questions about world history post c.1450 to determine helpful resources and consider multiple points of view represented in the resources.

8DB51A1366854D94A979799EE56FEA35.description: With assistance, develop a research plan, identify appropriate resources for investigating social studies topics, and create a research product which applies an aspect of world history post c.1450 to a contemporary issue

DEB6E339EA194BCF889E7C888957F79C.description: Explain connections between historical context and people's perspectives at the time in world history

90827C89C1AF4769AF8DC1276FF8DF56.description: Create and use tools to analyze a chronological sequence of related events in world history.

F5089A4306B44FAF84032F83B2D79F8C.description: Analyze the cultures of civilizations in sub-Saharan Africa, Mesoamerica, and Andean South America.

6D09B0172DAF40E8A80A9D0B70E4123A.description: Analyze how the Crusades and Black Death affected existing societies in Europe, Asia, and Africa.

39DBE210CA94492B8D04120638711836.description: Compare how the collapse of government and resulting instability led to the development of feudal kingdoms in Europe and Japan.

8A2A396A43D140438DAFA5240E830ACA.description: Analyze the role early civilizations had in shaping concepts of government, law, and social order.

A22C8372576046E0920CAD8725BACAD4.description: Explain the causes and results of the Agricultural Revolution in relation to the development of new and more complex societies in Asia, Africa, and the Americas.

B33EFCA2FF414598A8A2F3661DDA62FC.description: Analyze the causes and consequences of a specific problem in world history prior to c.1450 as well as the challenges and opportunities faced by those trying to address the problem.

8E643D93954C429288498C3FD1DB35DF.description: Analyze major demographic patterns to determine their effect on the human and physical systems

FB2705CF3CD146538F6D76058136CFEB.description: Explain how technology has reduced barriers and expanded people's capacity to make use of, or modify, the physical environment

C9F49D26B527431DA4C945012ED32A8E.description: Extrapolate the push-pull factors created by revolutions to determine their impacts on population distribution, settlements, and migrations.

9D86212D572C49A3B21CA04870AECBA3.description: Compare and contrast geographic regions by examining their cultural characteristics.

6F02F596BB2845C991CC4A0B56B8263B.description: Locate major cities of the world and key world nations; the world’s continents and oceans; and major topographical features of the world.

571DC8482C454CD8928DE7CB87E741E2.description: Identify the effect of natural forces upon human activities.

5C9BFF7EFFE347DE8350DE45A24351FE.description: Analyze the cultural characteristics of civilizations to explain how they are similar and different.

74F65B5F48B84B039D08746176766E0E.description: Describe how physical characteristics of river valleys supported permanent settlements and the rise of early civilizations.

DBECBB2E2F5B4F39A36636288016BBD5.description: Locate major cities of the world and key world nations; the world’s continents and oceans; and major topographical features of the world.

C27A737DE9ED459D89BD8520369BAF1E.description: Describe the impact of human settlement activities on the environmental and cultural characteristics of world regions prior to c.1450.

3A2D5E72CF41431BBB0FB249C7BBC860.description: Create and use maps and other graphic representations in order to explain relationships and reveal patterns or trends in world history prior to c.1450.

5C7FD586456249BCB2187AA676753FF8.description: Evaluate the response of individuals, groups, and governments to economic, environmental, health, and medical challenges to understand how systems change and evolve over time.

E3FA79EC4FDD4A089FD0DC2054BCD38F.description: Analyze economic systems such as market, mixed, and command to determine their impact on economic growth, labor markets, rights of citizens, the environment, and resource allocation in and among regions.

18500C08EA824DC0B65DCBAB57E0438D.description: Examine the connection among natural resources, entrepreneurship, innovation, labor, and capital to determine their effects on an industrial economy in Europe, Africa, Asia, and the Americas.

C81515A3FC2D4D5BB862704EA318349B.description: Analyze the origins and characteristics of laissez faire, market, mixed, and command economic systems to determine their effects on personal, social, and political decisions.

5D924FF781D548568B1CA46657CA2ADB.description: Describe how new sources of wealth, resulting from increasing global interactions, impacted cultures and civilizations.

CB6ECF7D0E80457EA5336480CC2B698C.description: Compare the origins, development, and effects of coercive labor systems in Asia, Africa, Europe, and the Americas

9CFAD510B3004F3FBF9E008A042FEFE8.description: Compare the extent, interaction, and impact of European, American, and Asian trade networks.

8ACF8B995B2C49168E564248B54A7A9A.description: Analyze the flow of good and ideas along ocean and overland trade routes to explain their contributions to economic success or failures of societies in Europe, Africa, Middle East, India, the Americas, and China.

3F7B27005802426DB6414B6E60FB7916.description: Using a world history lens, analyze the opportunity costs and benefits of economic decisions on society as a whole as well as on individuals post c.1450.

4E9D8AC06F914DB29BC7C9AC9E9722D9.description: Explain how inter-regional trade intensified the exchange of goods, ideas, and people.

D36FCECF88B7435591AD02B0AB2FEE37.description: Explain how political and economic stability affects the well-being of individuals and society.

A1B1F6163298433CB202996B318BC494.description: Explain how standardization impacts the stability of a civilization.

7B00F99E1F2F4E4F8D194D9762503745.description: Describe trade patterns and how they influence the movement of resources, goods, and services.

B617F053A6ED439EA006E2A219AFF5BA.description: Explain how standardization affects the early stability of a society.

6B8F9F566FFB4509849641C0DDE44A4F.description: Using a world history lens, explain how the concept of economic surplus led to trade and the emergence of specialized labor.

804D5FA5BDAC472EBAF6C6C7FA8B2BEC.description: Using a world history lens, examine the opportunity costs and benefits of economic decisions on society as a whole as well as on individuals prior to c.1450.

F287CC85A0B84060AA32AC3A1091ED75.description: Analyze treaties, agreements, and international organizations to determine their impact on world challenges along with national and international order.

B4B50874A08C4538BDB35F4DDA7A48F0.description: Compare and Contrast evolving governmental systems, including monarchy, theocracy, totalitarianism, and respresentative government to determine their impact on society

4FC33B67EA094FE1912C653974DCC012.description: Compare and contrast government systems resulting from political revolutions.

2472D88A66814283A424EBE361CBB49A.description: Compare and contrast limited and absolute governments and the extent of their impact on individuals and society

A785222E33A94E61AFDA5D158BAC59A2.description: Analyze the key ideas of the Enlightenment thinkers to explain the development of ideas such as natural law, natural rights, social contract, due process, and separation of powers.

789EEF446C024A29BE3B779C1AFC3898.description: Analyze the style and function of a leader to determine his/her impact on a governmental system.

D45D319F272C485EA381B60FE90BF01E.description: Describe how governments and institutions of the Eastern and Western Hemispheres changed to deal with the challenges and opportunities or an interconnected world.

90C06EB1D5E14CBBB70FB99E9F5B2223.description: Explain the influence of the classical revival on governmental systems, including their source of power, how leaders are selected, and how decisions are made.

EF4AACA82B2B4D41966FEF94C1F833BD.description: Explain how concepts such as the rule of law, limited government, and due process are developed through the Magna Carta and other influential documents.

3B708D3FB22848C8BA826C1C917CDAB8.description: Explain the origins, functions, and structure of governmental systems within civilizations

F513D48173754661955D2DE0F880BCA6.description: Analyze direct democracy and representative democracy in order to apply the concepts of majority rule, minority rights, and civic duty.

4F4B655AD53A4CD8A73F475863EA18F3.description: Explain the origins, functions, and structure of governmental systems within classical civilizations.

F77BADAF536D4ECDB2F34663D4E7179F.description: Explain how the codification of law impacted early civilizations.

ED4FA9AEB3C9443A85659F4152749722.description: Explain the origins, functions, and structure of monarchies, theocracies, city states, empires, and dynasties

1FD74D4BC72A4D0BAD5BFC46AEDFE06A.description: Analyze laws, policies, and processes to determine how governmental systems affect individuals and groups in society in world history prior to c. 1450.
